subject: Re: [junit] Redirect requested but followRedirects is disabled
msgSnippet: ... That surprises me. Can you see the page through a browser properly? It could be that the followRedirects message is being displayed, even though
messageBody:
saldin samuel wrote:

> Thanks for the reply. I have tried with
> WebClient.setRedirectEnabled() but I am still getting
> the same error.

That surprises me. Can you see the page through a browser properly?

It could be that the "followRedirects" message is being displayed, even
though redirects are being followed. I've seen that before. Pretend it
has nothing to do with your problem and post that stack trace again. We
might be able to help. If we could see source code of the test, that
would help, too.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com

Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
